meanings.definition: To form into grains or granules.
meanings.sent1: She granulated the sugar before adding it to the recipe.
meanings.sent2: The chef granulated the spices to enhance the flavor of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The baker accidentally granulated the flour all over the kitchen!
meanings.sent4: His plan slowly granulated into smaller, more manageable tasks.
meanings.sent5: The sand granulated between her fingers, creating a soothing sensation.

meanings.sent1: The granulated sugar added a sweet touch to the dessert.
meanings.sent2: The texture of the granulated sand felt rough against his skin.
meanings.sent3: The granulated appearance of the painting gave it a unique texture.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a granulated quality, like sandpaper on wood.
meanings.sent5: The granulated surface of the rock sparkled in the sunlight.
